body:
If one is not interested in the history (metadata) of a transaction "importaddress" and "importprivkey" don't require a pruned wallet to download the whole blockchain again (the utxo set is enough). So it's absolutely vital that this option is available in bitcoin core also because it means a pruned blockchain (of only a few GB) is independent of the wallet and can be downloaded by anyone possibly only checking the pruned blockchain randomly for a percentage of blocks. That is: checking the picture under "Simplified Payment Verification" in the Bitcoin white paper for some random blocks and maybe checking it also for each receiving transaction or imported address. It could also be much faster to check all blocks of a pruned blockchain instead of creating it from the raw blocks.These  procedures are  possibly essential for scaling bitcoin.

As I have checked, it is already possible in a pruned wallet to import addresses but they will only show new incoming transactions not the last UTXO value. 

If this feature is available, it's also possible to use a pruned Core wallet to go from a cold wallet to a hot (pruned core) wallet.

I have first discussed this issue with experts on Reddit here: https://redd.it/4w9s6q
title: In a pruned wallet, show balance of imported (watch only and active) addresses.
